text: Alexandre Astruc (13 July 1923 - 19 May 2016) was a French movie critic and movie director. He was known for being part of the French New Wave.Alexandre Astruc, "The Birth of a New Avant-Garde: La Caméra-Stylo,” in The New Wave, ed. Peter Graham. Trans. from Ecran Français 144, 30 March 1948. He was born in Paris. Astruc was known for his movies The Crimson Curtain, La Putain respectueuse, Les Mauvaises rencontres, Amour de poche, Une vie, and La proie pour l'ombre. In 1994, he was given the René Clair Award. Astruc died in Paris on 19 May 2016, aged 92.Le cinéaste et écrivain Alexandre Astruc est mort ==References== ==Other websites== * Alexandre Astruc on NewWaveFilm.com * * Foco - Revista de Cinema, special edition devoted to Alexandre Astruc Category:1923 births Category:2016 deaths Category:French movie directors Category:French movie critics Category:Writers from Paris
